result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Kirkland #583851 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
The Court would like Mental Health condition to be assessed, properly diagnose and provide treatment. 
Assessment for AODA and any treatment recommended be done while confined.
Conditions of extended supervision.
No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.
Comply with all conditions imposed by Agent and comply with mental health evaluations and treatment.
No contact with Rachel Baumann while on extended supervision unless approved by the Agent.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
Comply with any programming required by DOC.
Pay Supervision Fees.
When released maintain full time employment.
Complete a Domestic Violence assessment, complete any follow through recommendations, and to be completed within 6 months of being released.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

11:47 AM Defendant Michael J. Kirkland  #583851 in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion filed by Atty Helgeson for and orderto allow Defendant to reside with his wife. Atty Helgeson gives argument for allowing Defendant to reside with wife. Requesting the language to "shall reside". Atty Froelich responds. Court: suggests the Def look at what the victim wants and whats safe in terms in maintaining sobriety and domestic abuse situation. Ultimate goal is unification of family. Court cannot micromanage this system.  Atty Helgeson to prepare an order. 11:59
to Allow Contact filed by Atty Helgeson

02:34 PM Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court tried to call Columbia Correctional but was unable to connect. Helgeson: learned yesterday the prison was on lock down. Asking the court to move forward fpr argument. Atty Froelich agrees.  Atty Helgeson gives argument for petition for sentence adjustment and clarifies the petition issue on Ct#1 and Ct#2. Previous petiton was withdrawn. Atty Froelich responds; objetion to petition.  Atty Helgeson responds.  Court believes the petition was withdrawn timely.  Court will grant the petition with the agreement of the conditions of ES being amended: complete a domestic violence assessement and complete any recommendations, to be completed within 6 months of being released.  2:59

from Atty Helgeson re: Mr Kirkland withdraws his petition for sentence adjustment on Ct#2. RedGranite stated Mr Kirkland had completed Ct#2 sentence before Ct#1 and was not eligible for programming because of this. When the Petition for Sentence Adjustment was filed on Ct#1, the Department of Corrections stated he had already served Ct#1 and was now serving Ct#2 as it's standard to serve Ct#1 before Ct#2. Mr Kirkland is asking to be released on his petition for sentence adjustment on Ct#1 not Ct#2 on the belief he has already served Ct#1.

2:37 Defendant Michael J. Kirkland   VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM the Red Granite Correctional Institute #583851 in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Michael J. Kirkland  #583851 in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify sentence filed by Atty Helgeson.  Michael Kirkland sw, ex by Atty Helgeson. Exh#1-11; off/rec. Atty Froelich x ex. Court questions Def. Atty Helgeson redirect. Atty Froelich re x ex. Atty Helgeson gives closing argument; Requests no contact with Rachel be lifted. Allow Release to receive treatment. Atty Froelich gives argument opposing motion. Court: Def must prove a new factor. No exceptable new factor has been shown. Denies the motion. Court will write a letter to the warden at Red Granite and the Department of Corrections asking the Def be put in these programs as soon as possible.  Court: no contact with Rachel listed on JOC pertains to extended supervision. Court:  will amend the JOC to reflect no objection to Rachel visiting Mr Kirkland in prison. Prison rules with govern. Amend JOC to require Def to do AODA and other programs while on extended supervision. 3:41

9:39 Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM168 heard at this time. Froelich: guilty to charge in 15CM168. Files amended information with 3 counts; Def will plead guilty to all three. Requests PSI. time to determine restitution. Chapman and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Court reads charges and possible penalties contained in the amended information.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to charge in 15CM168 and Ct#1,2,3 contained in the amended information in 15CF190; Chapman stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of charge in 15CM168 and Ct#1,2,3 contained in the amended information. Court orders a PSI on 15CF190 and asks the agent to look at the facts in 15CM168 for a recommendations.
and restitution information

2:37 Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Chapman requests no contact to reduced to no abusive contact with Ms Baumann and their minor child. Also requests a furlough for a family visitation. Mr Culver offered to drop him off at the funeral. OSullivan: victim wishes to only have written contact; objects to the modification of no abusive contact until at least victim has gone through procedure at Turning Point. Objects to Def being released for a furlough for a funeral. Court addresses Ms. Baumann; agrees to just written contact. Court: modifies the bond to allow written contact between victim and Def. Denies request for furlough to funeral. OSullivan requests a modification of bond  to allow contact with Mr Deihl for the limited purposes of tax purposes. Chapman has no objection. Court grants requests of contact with Mr Deihl, but contact must be initiated by Mr Deihl.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Chapman would like to reserve the right to enter NGI plea at a later date.  Froelich has no objection to that.  Court in agreement.  Court reads charges and penalties to defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to Ct. 1, Ct. 2, Ct. 3, Ct. 4, Ct. 5, Ct. 6 and Ct. 7 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.    The bond will continue as ordered.   Pretrial Conference to be set.

11:25 a.m. 15CM168 followed along. Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Michael J. Kirkland in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich calls Officer Jason Mack.  Mack is sworn and takes the stand.  Froelich examines Mack.  Froelich - Exhibits 1, 2 and 3 - photos of Ms. Bauman.  Offered and received.  Mack identifies defendant.  Chapman cross-examines Mack.  Froelich calls Officer Ryan Hanson.  Hanson is sworn and takes the stand.  Froelich examines Hanson.  Hanson identifies defendant.  Chapman gives argument.  No objection to bind over.  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
